name: 01-Introduction
content:
Safety Stock Optimization -


Objective -

  • To scientifically determine optimal safety stock levels for each SKU by analyzing historical demand, lead time variability, and service level targets, ensuring the right balance between inventory availability and cost-efficiency.


Significance -

  • Reduces working capital tied up in excess inventory while maintaining high service levels.
  • Brings transparency and consistency to safety stock planning using data-driven statistical methods.
  • Enhances supply chain reliability by identifying variability in demand and lead times.
  • Supports better decision-making for procurement, planning, and replenishment teams through comparative analysis of multiple safety stock methodologies (Statistical, Max-Average, Time-Coverage).


Expected Outcome -

  • Optimized safety stock recommendations at 95%, 98%, and 99% SLA for every SKU.
  • Clear visual insights into demand variability, supplier performance, and inventory trends.
  • Identification of high-cost SKUs and service-critical items requiring exception handling.
  • Actionable strategies for phased MRP parameter adjustment and inventory reduction planning.
